name: Secrets Maroma Beach Riviera Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at SMB from July 7-14. It was the most perfect vacation imaginable. I did extensive research and struggled with whether this resort was the best choice for our 5-year anniversary trip, and it most certainly was.
reviews.title: Spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM:
reviews.title: Best vacation ever !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a Partial Ocean View Junior Suite. One week prior to arrival I emailed the lobby concierge (lobbyconcierge@secretsmaromabeach.com.mx) to express our excitement of celebrating our 5-year anniversary with the staff at SMB. We were not expecting an upgrade nor nervous about which room we would be assigned, for we knew any room would be beautiful. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a swim-out room. It was fabulous. We did not originally book a swim-out room because we didn’t think we’d use the swim-out pool. We were completely wrong about that. We spent time in our swim-out at least once a day and found it as the perfect reprieve from the sun and/or noise from the large pool. Plus, seeing the sun glisten on the water every morning was the perfect way to start each day.
reviews.title: Happiness is Maroma Beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: POOL:
reviews.title: Beautiful beach and great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two large pools separated by a concrete path and chairs. One pool is for the active: volleyball, water aerobics, water polo, pool bar. The other pool is closer to the ocean and much quieter. We sat on the quiet side of the pool so we could overlook the ocean; however, we often went in the “active” pool to play volleyball. There is another shallow water pool (less than 1’ deep) with chairs for couples who seek complete privacy. Whatever your mood, there is a place for you.
reviews.title: Ehhh..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Secrets Maroma for our honeymoon from 10/25/08-11/1/08. We booked through Liberty travel and upgraded our transfer to/from the airport to a private car from Olympus tours (they were great). This was our first trip to Mexico or an all-inclusive.
reviews.title: Wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road in isn't that bad...it's great to see land conservation in action.
reviews.title: NYC review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, there was quite a line for check-in so someone asked us if we minded waiting for a few minutes. We had to book our return airport transfer so we took care of that then. We were "double-upgraded" to a swim-out in building 12. I had originally wanted something on a higher floor, but the swim-out was fine.
reviews.title: Great stay at SMB

likes.disliked: — slow service at a couple restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great. I'm normally a privacy person, but the curtain between the tub and the bedroom didn't bother me at all. The safe was big enough to hold my purse and all of our travel documents.
reviews.title: Just got home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had the honeymoon banner, sparkling wine, and the fruit plate upon arrival, which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this all-inclusive resort for our anniversary, from 29 June to 5 July '09, and were somewhat disappointed in that there are very few little private, romantic, places to just be with your significant other after dark. We stayed at Excellence Riviera the last two years and must say that they have Secrets beat, where that is concerned. The service and food at Secrets was excellent, as far as we were concerned, however, there were some small ammenities, such as rose petals on the bed, being met with a glass of champaigne and hot, met with a hot, moist towel on arreval we didn't get, although others did. There were other small things that we expected, since it was our anniversary, that was advertised, that we didn't receive. Secrets is a beautiful property with an absolute fantastic beach. When you walk in the water the bottom is perfectly sandy, no rocks, pebbles, sea weed, or turtle grass, and water is crystal clear. One final comment, the pool area is pretty nice, but I defy anyone to find the 6 or 7 pools that's advertised. As I said, it's a beautiful property but I will not return, as I prefer moonlit places to sit and relax and romance my wife, Secrets has none of that.
reviews.title: A very nice resort with a fantastic beach but has potential to be much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to several different 4-5 star resorts in the Caribbean and four in the Cancun/Playa area over the past couple of years. El Dorado Royale, Excellence Playa Mujeres, Secrets Capri, La Zebra to name a few. Also, living next to downtown Dallas, we are blessed and frequent some of the best restaurants in the country, so we could be considered “picky” eaters.
reviews.title: A Secret Too Good to Keep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, Secrets Maroma offers great food, the best beach in Mexico and is a nice sized, new property only 30 minutes from CUN. Met many really nice couples and saw the broadest range of age – from young 20’s newlyweds to couples in their 70’s.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Beach, Average Experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room: We had a Jr suite ocean view (not a Preferred) – view of the water over top of trees – good sized w/ modern amenities – no liquor cabinet in room, but brought by request – sound of surf, birds and palms when balcony doors open – good a/c – TIP: No hair conditioner, bring your own, ladies – bldg had concierge, but we did not use or see until 3rd day – was not a negative to us.
reviews.title: best resort and beach in Mexico in 15 years of traveling South of the border

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa: Beautiful design – pricey - $40 credits per service aligned price with major metro area spas – Anti-aging facial OK, Swedish massage very good
reviews.title: Great Time-Honest review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How anyone can write a bad review about this hotel is beyond me. Our experience from the day we arrived to the day we left was fantastic. The hotel is immaculate and the rooms were modern with all the amenities one would expect from a 4-5 star hotel. We had a small issue with our room as we booked a partial view room and we couldn't see the ocean but were moved to a room with a good view within minutes.
reviews.title: Absolutely 1st Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were great with a quieter pool for relaxing and a lively pool with a more active atmosphere. We spent a bit of time in each of them depending on our mood.
reviews.title: Totally Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was like a postcard! We spent one day on the sun loungers on the beach and it was so relaxing. It was also nice to take a walk either way and take a dip in the bright blue sea.
reviews.title: Secrets Maroma Beach...Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great choice of restaurants and all were very high quality in terms of both the food and service. There are some nice bars to relax in too but if you want lively bars then best to head into Playa Del Carmen or Cancun. Our personal favorites were Bordeaux and Oceana but there wasn’t much in it as all were top class. Breakfast and lunch in the world café was also very good.
reviews.title: SMB: 4 stars (or maybe, less)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment was good and the whole team made a big effort even though the resort was 50-60% full.
reviews.title: Great Resort! Will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a breathtaking place to enjoy your honeymoon! My husband and I spent our vacation at the Secrets resort for our honeymoon 06/28-07/06. The room service was OUTSTANDING! Anything you want, you ask for it and you get it! Once we got there, we immediately got upgraded to a swimout suite that was closer to the beaches. We had a huge sash over our door the entire stay that said honeymoon and we came back to our room after dinner to drawn baths and rose petals all over the place. We were greeted with a nice "Welcome home" as they took our bags and brought them to our rooms very quickly. After sitting down with the concierge, having a piece of dessert and a glass of champagne, we were given a small tour of the facilities. Wonderfully landscaped. The pools were great and the beach was the best beach I have ever been to in my life! Not rocky at all like in CT. The sand was white and SO soft. The water was warm and crystle clear. The swimouts are highly recommended. Its wonderful to be able to go for a night swim whenever we wanted to. The food was great. The staff was friendly and EVERYONE...and I mean EVERYONE who walked by you said hello and good afternoon. Everyone was a such a pleasure and there are no complaints. We had the opportunity to go scuba diving (HIGHLY recommended). We also went to Aqua World which was great fun as well. Entertainment was good as well. They celebrated July 4th with a huge beach party and a great live band. We had a private dinner on the beach one night - be aware - its not EXACTLY private. There can be anywhere from 5-10 more couples not a couple of feet away from you...but you are still RIGHT on the beach. Still a VERY romantic night for the two of us. Private room service doors so you can get room service in the nude (if thats your thing) and they make your bed and clean your room twice a day! no problems with the water making us sick - except we were told not to drink any water form the faucets or shower head...but thats it!
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful stay at the Secrets Maroma Beach. Can't wait to go back on our anniversary! :)
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just to get an idea of how much we love this resort, we stayed here in November 2008, we returned in June, and we are going back next week. We usually travel to Mexico two times a year so we have stayed at several different resorts. This resort has the best combination of the hotel, the food, the beach and the service. The staff is awesome and we can't wait to get back there! We love Secrets Maroma!
reviews.title: Exceptional - A++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a couple in our mid 40's who have stayed at many 5 star resorts (ie Ritz Carleton)- this one exceeded our expectations in all areas:
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, but we decided we like Sandals better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach - extraordinary - nicest strip you'll find in Mexico
reviews.title: Perfection. You must go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay an SMB, hotel just opened about 3 months ago, so everything was nice and new- I loved the decor. Rooms are just perfect size with lots of storage space and super comfy mattress ,beautifull bathroom with jacuzi tub.
reviews.title: Beautifull hotel, gorgeous beach...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary and were treated with fruit basket and champagne on our arrival in the room and bubble bath with rose pettals in the evening.It was a rememberable and very nice touch on resorts side at no extra cost to us.
reviews.title: nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was delicious,7 restaurants to choose from. We especially loved French and Himitsu.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Himitsu twice, for hibachi and sushi dinner -both were spectacular.Waiters are really nice and take good care of you, we tip and you can tell they appreciate it. These people work very hard,Lots of choices at buffet, hamburgers at seaside grill were
reviews.title: SMB-Oct-21 to 28th...Great Hotel looks and Food...Someone stole my memory card

likes.liked: — The food and the the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the best I've ever had,great food all around
reviews.title: Beautiful Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will preface this review by telling everyone that I am in day #3 of a 10 day stay and will write a full review when I return. My stay is a work in progress but I would warn those considering booking a trip to this resort. I have been reading every review since the resort opening and to those of you that follow trip advisor know, everyone has different opinons and you have to read through the reviews to get the general consensus. We had booked on American Express through Newark, 4500 for 10 nights ocean front room. This was a great price at the time that I booked it in the first week of August. We could of had partial ocean view for 3250 but decided to splurge. I heard reviews that ocean front seemed to be a problem for some people that booked it so I called AE 3 weeks before leaving so that they would call the resort and make sure the ocean front buildings were open etc. They confirmed. So low and behold on our arrival there apparently was a flood in our room and they had no ocean fronts available. We said, fine just refund us. They told us it was between us and american express. They offered us another room and 200 spa credit and wanted us to sign a waiver. We wanted them to get AE on the phone they gave us the rep at the hotel who was equally as useless We told them to call the 800 number on our reservations which they finally did, AE called the hotel and they finally micraculously found a oceanfront room. Now we had not booked a swim up and we purposefully didnt due to the mosquito problem. The only room they had was in bulding 16 room 1710 and is a swimup which is in the ocean front building however there is a tiki hut on the beach along with equipment that occludes the view of the ocean, not to mention that it butss up to the neighboring hotel service buildings so we have a chain link fence on our side with the service people from the hotel going back and forth down the trail alongside the fence. Do not let them give you this room. So now we are waiting for our room to get fixed which they said could take up to a week or more because they have to change all the plumbing. They said they have no checkouts until Nov 8 and then we will be moved to the room that we actually paid for. But of course I meet someone who is in a ocean front and is checking out today but they played dumb when |I went to them with this information and asked me what room he was in and was he checking out early. I will not go to a secrets again. Are we enjoying ourselves. Yes we are not letting this ruin our vacation but I would not stay at another secrets again when you cant trust them and get what we paid for. I am still wondering if I should call EX again but want to just enjoy myself and not get caught up in all this. If you get a great deal 3000 for a week for partial ocean, go but this place is only worth it if you get a deal.
reviews.title: Disappointing so far. . .

likes.disliked: — Resort not having rooms available which were paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our vacation at this resort and I can honestly say it was the greatest vacation we have ever experienced! We were a little nervous on the ride in - the road leading to the resort is a bumpy single-lane dirt road that seemed to go on for miles. I can't tell how pleasantly surprised we were when the van arrived at the resort's entrance. It was beautiful! We were greeted by several employees "welcoming us home". We were immediately lead to the lobby bar where we were given champagne (or whatever your drink of choice may be) . We were taken almost immediately to our suite which we found to be absolutely stunning. The service we experienced during our stay was nothing less than excellent. (Special thank you to Ricardo, Laura and especially Rosy - you guys are the best!!!) The food, the atmosphere, the entertainment were all top-notch. We were trying to think of anything we would change and came up empty. Yes, there are a lot of mosquitos but, as long as you use repellant, it was not a problem. This resort does everything imaginable to make sure their guests are cared for and entertained at all times and, being in the customer service industry, I know this is no easy task. This resort is outstanding in every sense of the word. We highly recommend it to anyone considering a vacation to Mexico.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband and I and 3 other couples stayed here from Oct 16-19. This resort is beautiful, fun and a great get away. We absolutely loved the accomodations.The restaraunts were good and staff was friendly. The beach was pretty but rough waves kept us from enjoying snorkeling or other activitieson the water,so we spent alot of our time just relaxing . I would highly recommend this resort but I would definetly use the safe as we had about 150.00 stolen from my bag as well as my ipod. We left the resort and did not realize they were missing until we arrived at the airport .I have called the resort twice since we have been back. They are "investigating" it but have yet to hear any thing back from them. So, if you go keep your valuables close. But, I have to say besides this we had a wonderful time with our friends.
reviews.title: Great trip but money and ipod stolen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from a seven day stay at Secrets Maroma Beach (we are in our early 30’s). This was our 6th trip to the Cancun/Riviera Maya area and it turned out to be our best vacation yet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Which Made for a Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here’s the rundown:
reviews.title: Maroma was great even in 7 days of rain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My latest trip to Riviera Maya was a 3 day get-a-way for myself and my brother....We left the spouses at home. I have been to Riviera Maya many times, stayed at Royal Hideaway, Excellence, Dreams Tulum (now closed) , Blue Parrot , Secrets Capri and Riu Palace. I was very curious about Secrets Maroma. What most of the other reviewers said was true, horrible mosquito problem, mediocre food. Fantastic beach, personnel incredibly friendly,entertainment moderate. What may not have been mentioned is that the hotel was just too Americanized!! They tried to gear everything to the US traveler and they just went overboard. Music was mostly truly elevator music, little salsa or latin. Felt like you were in the hospital at one flew over the cuckoos nest. Fajitas and tacos are better at Taco Bell. If you ask the server, they will bring jabaneros, sour cream and other hot sause to "spice things up". Food was okay, just nothing special. My second complaint was that things in the room just didn't quite work correctly. Toilet paper roll was set too wide and evertime you pulled the paper the entire unit would fly across the floor, which was always wet because the shower floor was angled the wrong way and instead of water running down the drain, it collected (deeply) under the vanity with no hope of drainage. The ceiling fan never worked. Appeared that the switch had been worked on many times without success. There were light switches that didn't work and switiches that had no apparent purpose. Lights on the porch had no switches at all...Asked the room service person and he said the light switch for our porch was located in the room next to ours, as was the secret room service door (we had none). It seems that this resort has potential to be a very nice resort. But for such a new resort, they should take more care in fixing the little things that can be very annoying. But I'll say it again, the beach is awesome and hotel personnel great. Would I go back to that resort? probably not. For the $$$ there are much better all-inclusives in the area. One more thing, Hot water was only in your imagination. Had this beautiful huge hot tub in room and even bigger tub on deck, but alas, only ice cold water for most of the time we were there.
reviews.title: Need to make serious changes

likes.disliked: — Various items that were brokien in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are in our mid 20s and have been going to a Secrets resort every year since 2004. Past experiences with this chain have been nothing but the best! We 1st went to the Secrets Excellence in Punta Cana and have been to Capri twice. Until this trip we could not imagine going to any other all inclusive.
reviews.title: Not what we expected :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: CHECK IN- fast and easy, upgraded from a partial ocean view room to an ocean view. We stayed 7 days.
reviews.title: No Four Star Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD- we liked all the restaurants except the Oceana was horrible but other guests we talked to all agreed it was their least favorite too. Our favorite places were the Himitsu and the Italian.
reviews.title: Won't be staying at a Secrets property again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM- beautifully decorated, not much bathroom privacy, room service plates stayed in the little cubbie for days unless we called them to pick up, we were there for 3 days before our room was cleaned and we had to make a lot of phone calls to get that done, never had nightly turn down service or had our minibar fridge restocked. The AIR CONDITONER was our biggest problem with the room. It never got colder than 75 deg no matter how low you set it on, they sent maintenance men 4 different times but it was never fixed. My husband talked to our concierge, the front desk managers, we kept getting the run around telling us it would be fixed that afternoon, and then we'd return to a still hot, muggy room. Finally, on the 5th day Raphael, the rooms manager spoke with us. At first he offered us a free massage but after hot, sleepless nights and being jerked around by everyone that didn't seem to make things better, so he gave us 2 free nights on a return visit (although we doubt we want to return, even for free) and moved us to another room.
reviews.title: iPod Stolen From Housekeeping and Got the Run Around!!

likes.disliked: — room service stole my ipod and i got the run around from management.

aka: Secrets Maroma Beach Riviera Cancun Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: Secrets Maroma Beach Riviera Cancun is tucked away on secluded Maroma Beach, voted the World's Best Beach by the Travel Channel four years in a row. This unlimited-luxury heaven provides opulence to the most discerning traveler with a pure white sand beach, stunning ocean views stretching as far as the eye can see, elegant suites providing 24-hour room service, daily refreshed mini-bars and several of them with swim-out access to twelve smaller pools plus a shimmering infinity pool, gourmet dining options and chic lounges.
